short_definition: The accounting period for the federal government which begins on October 1 and ends on September 30.
long_definition_html:
The accounting period for the federal government which begins on October 1 and ends on September 30.

The fiscal year is designated by the calendar year in which it ends; for example, fiscal year 2013 begins on October 1, 2012 and ends on September 30, 2013. Congress must pass appropriations legislation to fund the government for every fiscal year.
